result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis Miguel Ocasio

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Louis Miguel Ocasio in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Louis Miguel Ocasio.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed to address rest of Court's calendar.

Case recalled at 11:17 am.  State is ready to proceed.  Defense counsel advises Court he is in trial in another court.  Court will reschedule jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br.41.
Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Louis Miguel Ocasio in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Louis Miguel Ocasio.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture and have no further motions to address prior to trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/5/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motions in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Defendant Louis Miguel Ocasio in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Motions and final pretrial documents due one week prior final pretrial. 
Statements by victim requesting No Contact Order modification. Arguments by parties. Court denies request at this time. 
Court orders case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Louis Miguel Ocasio in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with K.N. (4/9/90)
E.M.O.N. (2/26/14)

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Louis Miguel Ocasio in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Louis Miguel Ocasio in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Louis Miguel Ocasio appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
